result.title: Objective
result.description: To strengthen the management effectiveness of protected areas to respond to threats to the globally significant biodiversity in the Daxing’anling Landscape of Heilongjiang Province and Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description:
Financial sustainability score (%) for provincial systems of protected areas:
- Component 1 – Legal, regulatory and institutional frameworks
- Component 2 – Business planning and tools for cost- effective management
- Component 3 – Tools for revenue generation
- TOTAL

target.comment:
50% (for both HJ and IM)
25%
15%
30%

actual.comment: Indicator values remain unchanged as the baseline, i.e. 25 % (HJ), 23% (IM) 14% (HJ), 14% (IM), 7 % (HJ), 8% (IM), 16.4 % (HJ), 16.0% (IM), and will be updated by the MTR.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Average METT score of sample of 11 PAs in the Daxing’anling landscape as recorded in the BD-1 Tracking Tool

actual.comment: Indicator values remain unchanged as the baseline, i.e. 44, and will be updated by the MTR.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Status of selected indicator species that are rare and threatened (including inter alia: Lynx lynx, Ursus arctos arctos, Alces alces, Lepus timidus, Tetrao parvirostris, Bonasia bonasia, Grus vipio, Grus leucogeranus, Aix galericulata, Brachymystax lenok, Astragalus mongholicus, Chosenia arbutifolia)

baseline.comment: Baseline survey of selected indicator species in Year 1 (see methodological plan in Table 9)

target.comment: Key wildlife populations maintained or increasing;

actual.comment:
Indicator species listed are mostly very rare and not easy to quantify. Recent surveys and photos confirm they are all still present.
Model sites Duobukuer and Genhe have established qualitative diversity baseline of fish, birds, mammals, herps and wetland plants. EHI scores of those sites show stable or increasesin selected indicators since baseline surveys of 2013.
5 additional sites have all now identified their own indicator species and established new baselines. Deployment of automatic cameras will help add quantifiable basis for assessing indicator changes in future.
Lynx lynx - Very rare but occasionally seen Ursus arctos - Rare and absent from most areas Alces alces – widespread, scarce but stable
Lepus timidus – widespread, commonly seen Tetrao parvirostris - rare but still present Bonasia bonasia – Common and often seen Grus vipio, Grus leucogeranus – seasonal visitors
Aix galericulatus – common and breeding well Brachymystax lenox – getting rare but still present
Astragalus mongholicus – plant stable
Chosenia arbutifolia- populations stable, habitat OK.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Number of new jobs created for local people from sustainable use of the PAs

target.comment: 900 (HJ 600, IM 300) of which 115 women and indigenous people

actual.comment: 125 new jobs were created, including 70 in HJ (additional 100 are expected in the near future) and 55(35 men, 20 women) in IM.-to be done by PMUs.

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: Development planning frameworks for the Daxing’anling Landscape provide the enabling environment for expanding the forest and wetland PA network and mainstreaming biodiversity as an asset for sustainable development

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Biodiversity conservation strengthened through monetary and non-monetary valuation of ecosystem services

baseline.comment: No comprehensive (evidence-based) valuation of the ecosystem services exists

target.comment: Investment in biodiversity, PAs and a regional green development strategy is being supported through widely communicated assessment of the value of the Daxing’anling’s ecosystem services

actual.comment: The valuation is on-going through a subcontract entitled “Valuation of Biodiversity and Ecosystem Services of The Daxing’anling Landscape”, to provide a basis on PAs’ and a regional green development strategy in the region.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Threats reduced by mainstreaming biodiversity conservation and the PA system within the sectoral and development planning frameworks, indicated by effective intersectoral coordination and plans incorporating biodiversity conservation measures

baseline.comment:
No inter-sectoral coordination mechanism for biodiversity conservation and PAs exist at Landscape level
Sectoral plans do not include adequate measures for biodiversity conservation
12th 5 year plan includes chapter for biodiversity conservation but needs mainstreaming throughout

target.comment:
Inter-sectoral Group(s) for coordinating biodiversity conservation functioning and steering the process at landscape level
At least 2 sectoral plans (among forestry, tourism, agriculture, water, mining) integrate biodiversity conservation measures, including clear safeguard measures in sector practices
13th 5 year-Plan recognises clear linkage between biodiversity and PAs and sectoral development, and includes PA and biodiversity-related targets

actual.comment:
The Project Coordination Groups (PCG) of Heilongjiang and Inner Mongolia FMAs established, comprising focal points from relevant sectors/divisions (including conservation, science, water, environment, silviculture, tourism, planning, industry, agriculture, livestock and fishery, finance, communications as well as the demonstration site FMB and representatives of local communities); the first meeting held, respectively, to advise the project and promote mainstreaming of biodiversity and protected areas into key development plans.
Plans incorporating biodiversity conservation measures formulated or drafted within the reporting period include 1) HJ: (1) "Ecological Conservation and Improvement Plan of Heilongjiang Province" (2014-2020) promulgated by the Forestry Department of Heilongjiang provincial government, "Plan of Building Daxing’anling Eco Civilization (Years 2013-2020) ", "Plan of Building Eco Civilization (2013- 2020) in Daxing'anling" and " Daxing'anling Low-Emission Development Plan" by the Administrative Office of Development and Reform Commission of Heilongjiang, "13th‘5-year Plan’ of the Forest Group Company ", "Plan of Building Eco- Civilization Demonstration Areas in Daxing’anling (Years 2014 - 2018)", " Programme of Building Forest Ecological Conservation and Building National Demonstration PAs in Daxing’anling, Heilongjiang" by the Forestry Group Company, "Implementation Plan of Daxing’anling Ecological Conservation and Improvement" by the Provincial Administrative Office. Moreover, Nanwenhe NNR and other 7 NNRs have been listed in "Heilongjiang Provincial Wetland Eco-tourism Plan" by Provincial Tourism Bureau; 2) in IM, provisions of “Improvement of Forestry Eco System”, “Building Bio-originated Economic System”, etc. have been integrated into the “Notice on National Forestry Reform” by the Forest Industry Group (Forest Authority. Biological conservation, e.g. wildlife (flora and fauna) protection, will be integrated in
“Inner Mongolia Forest 13th 5-year Plan”, which has been formulating since late 2014. In April 2015, Inner Mongolia Forest Industry Group (Forest Authority) has been approved by the National Development and Reform Commission and other departments as a “Demonstration Area for Eco protection and construction”, thanks to the advices and support of the PCGs.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description:
Expanded and more representative PA system approved
Area of PAs upgraded to National status
Area of PAs upgraded to Provincial status

baseline.comment:
3.10 million ha (including 1.27 million ha of natural wetlands)
1.00 million ha
1.32 million ha

target.comment:
4.20 million ha (including 2.05 million ha of natural wetlands)
1.57 million ha
1.44 million ha

actual.comment:
An expanded and more representative PA system has been planned and initiated at provincial level, and that at the regional level will be done in 2016.
Overall, areas of PAs upgraded to national status increased by 71,460 hectares, and that upgraded to the provincial status by 106,288 hectares.
In Heilongjiang, 3 new National Wetland Parks (pilots) were established increasing PA areas by 14,856 ha; 2 provincial nature reserves were newly designated covering an added protection area of 68,612 hectares.
In Inner Mongolia, 1 natural reserve was upgraded to national level with a protection area of 56,604 hectares, and the area of newly upgraded provincial NR is 37,676 hectares.

result.title: Outcome 2
result.description: The management effectiveness of the PA network across the Daxing’anling landscape is greatly strengthened

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Capacity development scorecard (%) for the protected area system

baseline.comment:
49% (Heilongjiang)
41% (Inner Mongolia)

target.comment:
60% (Heilongjiang)
55% (Inner Mongolia)

actual.comment: Indicator value remains unchanged as the baseline, i.e. 49%(HLJ)and 41% (IM), and will be updated by the MTR.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Landscape level PA financing (for salaries and operational costs) increased to close by 50% the existing annual financing gap for basic expenditure scenario (planned through business plans and tracked with PA financial sustainability scorecard)

baseline.comment:
US$ 2.980 million / year (HJ)
US$ 4.083 million / year (IM)

target.comment:
US$ 12.322 million / year (HJ)
US$ 5.614million / year (IM)

actual.comment:
Totally $12.053 million, including Heilongjiang received funds of $5.767million, Inner Mongolia got funds of $6.286 million (rate 6.2).
In 2014, operational funds for Heilongjiang’s 5 NNR was ?21.765 million yuan in total, plus ?9.99 million yuan of national nature reserve infrastructure project funds and ?4 million yuan of the central government subsidies for wetland protection; .
Inner Mongolia’s 3 NNR received ?19.9069 million yuan of wetland protection subsidy from the central government, ?5.0697 million yuan for the implementation of a national wetland protection project.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Increase in annual operational budgets for PAs

actual.comment:
The sum total is ?4.8846 million yuan in RMB, equivalent to US$787,800.
In 2014, annual operational budgets for PAs in Heilongjiang’s five NNR was ?2.344 million yuan more than that in 2013; of Inner Mongolia’s 3 NNR, the figure was ?2.5406 million yuan more than that in 2013.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Number of trained staff with certified competency standards

target.comment: 300 PA trainees to competency standards in at least 5 subject modules

actual.comment: A total of 238 people were given training, including 63 from Heilongjiang, 175 from Inner Mongolia. Besides, more people, e.g. governmental officers in charge, project staff and PA managers/staff, will be trained through an on-going subcontract entitled “Training for strengthening the systemic, institutional and operational capacity of PAs in Daxing’anling Landscape” to address technical gaps in PA staff skills.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Reduction in illegal incidents within the PAs – poaching, illegal harvesting, etc., despite improved activity of rangers

baseline.comment:
Inner Mongolia section: average of 2908 administrative cases and 79 criminal cases (2009 & 10)
Heilongjiang section: average of 95 administrative cases and 20 criminal cases (2010 & 11)

target.comment: 10% decrease from the baseline for each province section despite improved rangering

actual.comment:
Inner Mongolia section: average of 37 administrative cases and 0 criminal cases (2014) Heilongjiang section: average of 4 administrative cases and 0 criminal cases (2014).
In 2014, the Heilongjiang region assigned more than 3700 people-times and more than 1350 vehicles-times to inspect criminal cases related to biodiversity conservation on the market, restaurants and other establishments inspected 680 sites. Besides, a total of 118 unauthorized visitors/villagers were expelled from the PAs, more than 3500 passing vehicles were inspected, 870 hunting gear were impounded, more than 170 live birds released, 8 wildlife and wild animal products were impounded, and 4 wildlife cases were uncovered.
In the Inner Mongolia area, there was no criminal case found in PAs during this period, thanks to the strengthened enforcement of relevant laws, regulations and policies by both the authorities and local people that has been greatly promoted and supported by the project. For example: Hanma National Reserve strengthened the monitoring and publicity, developed relevant work processes, systems and management practices, developed a wildlife patrol monitoring system, and carried out regular inspection, supervision and guidance of the implementation. A total of 30 automatic infrared cameras have been emplaced for effective monitoring in populous areas of wildlife. 16 additional wildlife monitoring sites have been established. Furthermore, several special reports and articles had been published for raising the public awareness. At the Erguna NNR, 5 times patrolling were carried out into the mountain areas, removed 2 sets of hunting gear, evicted 24 person/times of people illegally entered into the protected areas for construction, exploration, hunting and fishing purposes.

result.title: Outcome 3
result.description: Effective PA management is demonstrated in the Duobuku’er NNR and the Genheyuan NWP

indicator.description:
Management effectiveness increased in both demonstration sites (based on METT scores)
Duobuku’er NNR
Genheyuan NWP

actual.comment: Indicator values remain unchanged as the baseline, i.e. 35(Duobuku’er NNR)and 46 (Genhe NWP) respectively, and will be updated by the MTR.

actual.comment: EHI values remain unchanged as the baseline, i.e. 0.51(Duobuku’er NNR)and 0.62 (Genhe NWP), and will be updated by the MTR.

result.title: Objective
result.description: To strengthen the management effectiveness of the wetland protected area system in Anhui in response to existing and emerging threats to the globally significant biodiversity and essential ecosystem services

actual.comment: 15 pilot provincial-level wetland parks were established, and the wetland protected area increased further by 30,202 ha in 2014, which had achieved 37.8% of the total target. These 15 pilot wetland parks along Yangtze River in Anhui have great value of biodiversity and will strengthen the management effectiveness of Anhui WPAs.

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: Provincial capacity for PA management is enhanced and pressure on wetland systems are reduced by provision of safeguards and legislation that provide protection from sector practices, by increased and sustainable financing of the PA system, and by increasing the protected wetland area in the province

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: 1.1 (a) New WPA coverage increased by 80,000 ha; (b) 3 wetlands of provincial level identified to be promoted to national PAs; (c) Shengjin Lake Wetland identified to be listed as a Ramsar site and endorsed by SFA and Government of China.

baseline.comment: (a) Current protected area coverage is 353,200 ha; (b) Anqing Riverine PNR and Huayanghe Lakes PNR intend to be upgraded as NNR; (c) no NNR listed as a Ramsar site in Anhui Province.

target.comment: Expansion of WPA coverage by 80,000 ha; 3 provincial-level wetland upgraded to national PAs; Shengjin Lake NNR listed as a Ramsar site and endorsed by SFA and Government of China.

actual.comment: 15 pilot provincial-level wetland parks were established, and the wetland protected area increased further by 30,202 ha in 2014, which had achieved 37.8% of the total target.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: 1.2: a) Mainstreaming of wetland biodiversity into sector policies to reduce the threats from sectors to wetlands; b) Improvement in Institutional Capacity Score for AFD (75%) and AED (74%).

baseline.comment: a) Lack of mainstreaming of wetland biodiversity into sector policies; b) AFD (58%) and AED (58%).

target.comment:
Wetland biodiversity brought into sector policies;
AFD 75%, AED 74%

actual.comment:
Provincial-level PSC meeting was held and suggestions on project management were raised. The draft of Anhui Wetland Conservation Plan (2015~2030) was finished and was in process of being revised.
Institutional Capacity self-assessment:
AFD64%
AED63%

indicator.description: 1.3: Improve and issue the Regulations on Wetlands Protection of Anhui Province.

baseline.comment: There are no specific provincial wetlands regulations.

target.comment: Prov. wetlands regulations are promulgated by the Provincial People's Congress (PPC).

actual.comment: The draft of Wetland Regulation for Anhui Province was finished and was in the process of being revised. The latest review was made by Office of Legislative Affairs of Anhui Province, which is expected to be enacted in late 2015.

indicator.description: 1.4: (a) Increase in government financing for PA operations including PA infrastructure development; (b) develop other revenue sources and increase the part directly for wetland protection.

$ 1,077,000.
Infrastructure etc.
$ 3,970,000

For Provincial WPAs, operational budget is increased by 30% to $1,400,000.
Infrastructure etc budget is increased by 30% to $5,161,000

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: 2.2: a) Basin Plan for Shengjin Lake basin is developed and approved by Chizhou City government and applied in at least two additional nature reserves; b) Sustainable eco-tourism plan for Shengjin Lake basin is developed.

baseline.comment: a) No Basin Plan and tourism plan exist now; b) No eco-tourism plan for Shengjin Lake NR and basin exists now.

target.comment: A completed and approved inter-sectoral basin plan developed and applied in NRs; Sustainable eco-tourism plan developed and implemented.

actual.comment:
The Integrated Shengjin Lake Basin Management Plan was drawn up and will be finished in 2016.
The Sustainable eco-tourism plan for Shengjin Lake basin will start to be drawn up in the fourth quarter of 2015 in accordance with the project work-plan.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: 2.3: Establishment of an effective basin level cross-sectoral institutional mechanism with representation from PA, local communities and local government.

baseline.comment: No basin level cross-sectoral institutional mechanism now exist.

target.comment: Operational basin-level coordination mechanism.

actual.comment: A cross-sectoral Shengjin Lake Basin Management Committee in Chizhou City established. Legislative Affairs Office of the municipal government, Municipal Development and Reform Commission and other 18 departments will work together to strengthen the cooperation, coordination and management effectiveness of Shengjin Lake WPA.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: 2.4: Systems for knowledge management and exchange developed.

baseline.comment: No systems for knowledge management and exchange.

target.comment: Knowledge management and exchange systems developed.

actual.comment: Expect to be done in 2016.

result.title: Outcome 3
result.description: Strengthened operational capacities reduces on-site threats to biodiversity in Shengjin Lake NNR

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: 3.1: Shengjin Lake NNR Management Plan is developed and approved

baseline.comment: No Management Plan

target.comment: Full Management Plan approved and implemented

actual.comment: Shengjin Lake NNR Management Plan was drawn up and will be finished in 2016.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: 3.2: a) determine fishing quota of the lake based on its ecological capacity; Incidence of encroachment of intensive fishing in lake habitats especially in core areas reduced; b) improve biodiversity and ecosystem health of Shengjin Lake, Anqing Riverine Wetlands and Shibasuo.

baseline.comment:
a) No fishing quota based on ecological capacity calculation; Encroachment is taking place; b) EHI:
Shengjin Lake 0.45, Anqing Riverine Wetlands 0.43, and Shibasuo 0.41.

target.comment:
Fishing quota determined; By end of project all fishing carried out according to established quotas and outside the core areas (Note: If economic activities are excluded from the core areas, there are no waters for them, and it is impossible to implement the component of the project (ecotourism, fisheries with quotas).;
EHI Targets
Shengjin Lake = 0.70
Anqing WPA = 0.61
Shibasuo WPA = 0.63

actual.comment:
Self-assessment by WPAs staff:
Shengjin Lake = 0.52
Anqing WPA = 0.483
Shibasuo WPA = 0.47 The habitat connectivity, water supply and oxygen levels had been improved due to most of the fishing nets were moved in the upper and middle lakes of Shengjin Lake and the lake is restored gradually. All these aspects led the improvements in the Shengjin Lake EHI scores. Actions: The Integrated Shengjin Lake Basin Management Plan and other neighboring WPA plans will be developed. The project will also have sub-contracts to restore and demonstrate waterfowl habitat at the upper and middle lakes of Shengjin Lake, build small “artificial” wetland, have training and communication to reduce sewage emission through local community co-management.
Work of fishing quota and habitats restoration will start in the fourth quarter of 2015 in accordance with the project work-plan.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: 3.3: a) the professional skills of the staff have been improved; b) local communities can get benefit from PA community co-management.

baseline.comment: a) Capacity building in the reserve needs to be done; b) there is almost no economic benefit for communities.

target.comment: Conservation protection skills increased; benefit increased by 10% from METT baseline.

actual.comment: EHI training was held and 12 staff from 7 NRs attended. Public awareness was raised though Wetland Day and Bird-loving Week.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: 3.4: Area of key habitat restored through co-management and populations of key species such as Oriental Stork, Siberian White Crane, Hooded Crane and Swan Goose are stabilised.

baseline.comment:
Several lake habitats are degraded.
Reports of decrease in key wildfowl species.

target.comment:
At least 50% of the wildfowl habitats are restored (with at least 3 times natural aquatic vegetation than pre-restoration).
Population of key species remaining stable

actual.comment: The total population of key species (winter birds) reduced from 2012 to 2014. The corresponding actions planned. NRs and Local people in 5 WPAs patrol and monitor wetland biodiversity through co-management and the work of restoring and demonstrating waterfowl habitat at the upper and middle lakes of Shengjin Lake and neighboring WPAs will start from 2016 according to the work plan.

result.title: Objective
result.description: The project will address the POPs/PTS release sensitive e-waste stream in the recycling, dismantling, treatment and final disposal processes of Waste Electrical and Electronic Equipment (WEEE).

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Efficient and functional EPR and WEEE management system

baseline.comment: EPR Treatment Fund established but not efficiently functional

target.comment: National policy about EPR finalised.

actual.comment: This is the third year of EPR Treatment Fund implementation at the national level. (REMARK:The EPR treatment fund is implemented by government involved many ministries on July, 2012.) A more standard guideline on e-waste dismantling was updated. The policy on 9 new kinds of e-waste dismantling standard has been in progress of being updated, which will enable the EPR Treatment Fund to be implemented more smoothly.

target.comment: Improved operational mechanism of EPR Treatment Fund and WEEE management

actual.comment: No further regulation was issued during this period. The policy research is in preparation.

target.comment: At least 250 management personnel at national and demonstration locations trained on EPR concept and WEE management system.

actual.comment: 63 management persons were trained in the last year. Three local PMOs organized the training by themselves.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Amount of WEEE treated by permitted recyclers in the three demonstration locations

baseline.comment: Over 2 million units of WEEE collected and processed by permitted recyclers at the 3 demonstration

target.comment: Estimated 50% increased of WEEE collected and processed

actual.comment: Over 2 million units of WEEE were recollected and processed under the strict monitoring by local EPBs in our three demonstration provinces: Tianjin, Jiangsu and Hubei. Because of the huge statistics, the current data only reflects the dismantling WEEE from 1 July 2014 to 31 march 2015. The latest data will be calculated in next annual project report.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Number of facilities replicating or establishing sound WEEE recycling

target.comment: At least 2 BAT/BEP technologies for pretreatment demonstrated and relevant technical guidelines finalised

actual.comment: N/A

target.comment: At least 2 BAT/BEP technologies for disposal demonstrated, end gas discharge of PCDD/PCDF to meet pollution control standards for hazardous waste incineration if incineration technology selected. Relevant technical guidelines finalised.

actual.comment: N/A

indicator.title: Indicator 7
indicator.description: Number of workers received training in sound WEEE processing

target.comment: At least 25,000 technical workers trained on BAT/BEP and sound WEEE processing

actual.comment: At the first year of project implementation, all of the trainings were organized by demonstration areas themselves. For example, Xiangyu from Jiangsu province invited technical expert Mr. Wei to give their technical workers process and safety training twice last year. Bowang from Hubei province invited technical expert from Wuhan University to give their technical workers process and safety training twice during this period. Around 6,300 workers were trained in three demonstration areas.

indicator.title: Indicator 8
indicator.description: Market based WEEE processing infrastructure demonstrated and developed

baseline.comment: Low rate of WEEE collection and recycling by formal sector

target.comment: Demonstration of collection successfully completed at selected enterprises

actual.comment: Work in Progress. Three subcontracts were signed in demonstration areas. Multi-channel recycling ways were operated in the enterprises to reach the recycling goal as planned.

baseline.comment: Dominated by primitive and manual processing of WEEE

target.comment: Technology demonstration activities at selected enterprises at the three demonstration provinces/municipality successfully completed

actual.comment: Ongoing. Three subcontracts were signed with Local Project Management Offices. Parts of the production lines were updated in the first year, for example, Xiangyu in Jiangsu Province added a new TV dismantling line, TCL in Tianjin added some new dust exhausts on their original TV dismantling line. 3 LPMOs assumed responsibility for project implementation in each of their respective demonstration area and gathered required information as planned.

target.comment: Over 5,000 tons of Brominated Flame Retardants (BFR) containing plastic/resins performed/reused annually

actual.comment: 15,000 tons of Brominated Flame Retardants (BFR) containing plastic/resins processed was estimated. About 24 kg of BFRs were processed safely in this period.

target.comment: Over 5,000 tons of CRT to be recycled annually from environmental emission annually in the demonstration locations

actual.comment: N/A

target.comment: 5 WEEE technical guidelines about eco-design finalised.

actual.comment: N/A

target.comment: Eco-design for at least one electrical and electronic equipment developed

actual.comment: Ongoing. The project is liaising with the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology (MIIT), who is the most relevant to the electronics manufacturing industry, responsible for encouraging cleaner production and eco-design of electrical and electronic equipment, as well as providing technical and policy support to MOF, MOC, NDRC and MEP on development and implementation of the WEEE management system including identification of technology requirements.

indicator.title: Indicator 14
indicator.description: Informal WEEE processing facilities upgraded and integrated into EPR system through diversion into informal processing facilities

baseline.comment: Large percentage of WEEE is estimated to be collected and processed by the informal sector

target.comment: Three types of WEEE collection/recycling demonstrated and successfully completed at three selected provinces/municipality.

actual.comment: N/A

indicator.title: Indicator 15
indicator.description: Number of newly registered WEEE processors

baseline.comment: Zero.(No more enterprises became to the registered WEEE processors

target.comment: Increase WEEE collected and channeled by informal or newly registered (ex-informal) collectors to formal recycling enterprises for treatment

actual.comment: At the end of the 2013, 91 WEEE processors had been established. By the end of 2014, 106 WEEE processors were registered totally by the MEP, which were considered as national activities in this project. At the next step, the project will revise the WEEE processor register regulation because of 9 new type e-wastes involved.

target.comment: New WEEE entities registered and qualified and elegible to receive EPR Treatment Fund subsidies

actual.comment: N/A

result.title: Outcome 1.1
result.description: Operational national EPR system covering priority POPs/PTS release sensitive E-Waste streams

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Number of companies in EPR system

baseline.comment: Approximately120 formal enterprises

target.comment: All newly established and qualified formal enterprises are required to be registered

actual.comment: 106 registered WEEE have been established.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Amount of WEEE processed by companies receiving EPR Treatment Fund

baseline.comment: 2,000,000 units WEEE collected and processed at the three demonstration provinces/municipality

target.comment: Estimated 50% increase in WEEE collected and processed in the demonstration locations

actual.comment: Around 2 million units of WEEE were recollected and processed in our three demonstration provinces.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Amount of funds disbursed by the EPR Treatment Fund

target.comment: Nationally, RMB500 million disbursed annually from EPR Treatment Fund

actual.comment: In total (at the national level) around 5 billion RMB was disbursed from EPR Treatment Fund last year (Jan – December 2014).

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: At least one training per year conducted disseminating international EPR experience

baseline.comment: No training with input of international experience

target.comment: 3 trainings conducted

actual.comment: N/A

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Integrated information/data management system installed and utilised by MOF for disbursement under the EPR Treatment Fund

baseline.comment: Preliminary database used by MOF to calculate and manage subsidy and disbursement

target.comment: Fully established data-base, with all EPR Treatment Fund disbursements released through the Integrated Information Data Management System

actual.comment: N/A

result.title: Outcome 1.2
result.description: Adopted and implemented national technical standards and operational business documentation governing the management of WEEE in support of the EPR system.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Number of technical standards finalised

baseline.comment: No specific technical standard document available for collection, logistics, pre-treatment, material recovery and hazardous waste disposal

target.comment: 2 technical standard documents finalised

actual.comment: N/A

result.title: Outcome 1.3
result.description: Applied LCA/LCM procedures and labelling for product design and production

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Five eco-design standard documents

baseline.comment: None exist

target.comment: Eco-design document finalized and made available

actual.comment: N/A

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Electric and electronic product eco-design developed

target.comment: Eco-design for at least one electrical and Electronic equipment developed

actual.comment: N/A

result.title: Outcome 1.4
result.description: Achieved public awareness and stakeholder consensus on the detailed design and implementation of the national EPR system.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: One stakeholder nodal body is established

baseline.comment: No coordination body exist for WEEE stakeholders

target.comment: 1 multi-stakeholder platform established

actual.comment: N/A

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: At least one public awareness campaign conducted every year

baseline.comment: None. Level of awareness to be established during first year of implementation

target.comment: 3 public awareness campaigns conducted in the demonstration provinces/municipality

actual.comment: Every LPMO organized public awareness campaign at province level. For example, the TCL from Tianjin was jointly Baidu recycling launched by UNDP, MEP, involving film star Ms.Zhao Wei as advocate with both local and international news coverage in August, 2014. Hubei PMO made a short video broadcast in Wuhan city subway from 4th to 6th June, 2015. Jiangsu PMO combined Jiangsu Tencent launching an O2O way in e-waste recycle in May 2015. All of the activities provided public awareness on e-waste as well as to where the e-waste was sent.

result.title: Outcome 1.5
result.description: Implementation of effective discrimination between second hand product and e-waste imports.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Training Guidelines for the control of imports are made available to the relevant government agency

baseline.comment: None existed

target.comment: Guidelines compatible with Basel Convention finalized and made available and used by relevant government agencies

actual.comment: N/A

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Training programme and workshop

baseline.comment: None implemented

target.comment: Guidelines documents of the Basel Convention are used

actual.comment: N/A

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Criteria for discrimination between e-waste and second hand product established and used by relevant government authorities

baseline.comment: None implemented

target.comment: Guidelines documents of the Basel Convention are used as reference

actual.comment: N/A

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Contacts and communication with major exporting countries established

baseline.comment: No active activities

target.comment: Possibilities and mechanisms of cooperation and coordination explored and activities initiated

actual.comment: Ongoing. Cooperating with Basel Convention Regional Centre for Asia and the Pacific, the project will design some activities on e-waste illegal exporting in China.

result.title: Outcome 2.1
result.description: Utilization and upgrading of the existing domestic WEEE collection system to efficiently and cost effectively supply registered WEEE processing facilities particularly for POPs/PTS sensitive e-waste constituents.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Diagnostic studies and action plan conducted with at least one recycler in each demonstration province

baseline.comment: None

target.comment: 3 diagnostic reports and action plan finalised

actual.comment: Relevant working is in preparation.

result.title: Outcome 2.2
result.description: Operation of a comprehensive national network of registered WEEE processing facilities to dismantle and process POPs/PTS release sensitive materials in an environmentally sound manner utilizing demonstrated BAT/BEP technologies.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Authorized recyclers registered with the EPR Treatment Fund

baseline.comment: Only about 120 formal recyclers registered

target.comment: All newly established formal recyclers in the demonstration provinces/municipality are registered

actual.comment: 15 new WEEE processors were registered. At the end of the 2013, 91 WEEE processors were established already. By the end of the 2014, 106 WEEE processors were registered totally by the MEP, which were considered as national activities in this project. At the next step, we will revise the WEEE processor register regulation because of 9 new types of e-waste involved.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Operational Guidelines for upgrading to technical standards are made available

baseline.comment: None

target.comment: 3 operational guideline documents finalized and made available

actual.comment: N/A

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Technical guidelines for pre-treatment of WEEE prepared

baseline.comment: None existed

target.comment: Technical guideline for pre-treatment of WEEE finalized and made available

actual.comment: N/A

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Demonstration initiatives implemented with at least one recycler in each demonstration province/municipality

baseline.comment: None

target.comment: 3 demonstrations activities implemented

actual.comment: Ongoing. The local PMOs signed with demonstration enterprises to ensure enough e-waste get recycled. The enterprises recycled e-waste using multi-channel recycling supported by the project.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Risk assessment undertaken to evaluate the establishment of a network of regional facilities

baseline.comment: None

target.comment: At least 3 assessment reports completed

actual.comment: One risk assessment report on dismantling, "E-waste dismantling enterprises pollutant", was released. The report indicated the release of pollutants and health risks during dismantling.

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description: At least one no-ferrous metal smelter processing printed curcuit boards with precious metal recover 85%

baseline.comment: None

target.comment: Emission meeting pollution control standard for hazardous wastes incineration

actual.comment: N/A

result.title: Outcome 3.1
result.description: Characterization of overall national scale, scope and impacts associated with the informal e-waste processing inclusive of identification high priority regions and centres.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Characterization study highlighting the most critical processes from the informal WEEE recycling sector undertaken

baseline.comment: Several reports mentioned the informal sector but data not clear due to data scarcity

target.comment: Characterisation study report completed and finalized

actual.comment: N/A

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Guidance document completed and information disseminated

baseline.comment: No guidance document available on measurement of impacts associated with informal recycling

target.comment: Guidance document finalized

actual.comment: N/A

result.title: Outcome 3.2
result.description: Provision of policy, regulatory enforcement and awareness support provided through MEP to the local level related to supervision of the informal WEEE sector.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: WEEE flows from informal sector to registered recyclers are monitored by the EPR Treatment Fund

baseline.comment: No registered exchange between informal and formal recyclers

target.comment: Enforcement actions on informal recyclers and efforts to divert e-waste to formal sector

actual.comment: Ongoing. One enforcement activity was performed in Tianjin city aiming at informal e-waste sectors in August 2014.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: At least one awareness campaign conducted in each demonstration province/municipality

baseline.comment: None

target.comment: 3 awareness campaigns conducted

actual.comment: 3 awareness campaigns were carried out in Tianjin, Jiangsu and Hubei separately. Reference above.

result.title: Outcome 3.3
result.description: Demonstration of collective infrastructure supporting informal WEEE processors and providing environmentally sound dismantling operations related to POPs/ PTS release developed and integrated with the national EPR system recycling network for further processing.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Pilot interventions implemented based on technical standards for collection and logistics

baseline.comment: None

target.comment: At least 3 pilot interventions implemented

actual.comment: Ongoing. Three subcontracts were signed in the project’s demonstration areas. Multi-channel recycling ways were applied and operationalized in the five demonstration enterprises to reach the recycling goal as planned.

result.title: Outcome 4.1
result.description: Monitoring and evaluation, knowledge sharing and information dissemination

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Timing and quality of annual (APRs, PIRs etc.) and M&E reports. Quality appraisal in Mid-Term Review and Terminal Evaluation.

baseline.comment: Indicative M&E plan, budget and timeframe

target.comment: M&E activities implemented as scheduled and project implementation monitored to achieve project objectives

actual.comment: One Annual Project Report, one Project Implementation Report, one Annual Work Plan, four Quartor Project Reports, 6 Funding Authorization and Certificate of Expenditures were prepared during this reporting period.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Lessons learned and experience documented and disseminated; post-project action plan formulated

baseline.comment: None

target.comment: Lessons and experience documented and disseminated

actual.comment: N/A

result.title: Outcome 5.1
result.description: Strengthened project management capacities and efficiency

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Timely project implementation and disbursement

baseline.comment: Existing staff

target.comment:
Capacity of National Project Team strengthened. In additional to existing staff, a Project Coordinator and a secretary are recruited.
National Project Team established, staffed, equipped and trained

actual.comment: National Project Team established and 1 project manager was recruited.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: LPMO established in each demonstration provinces/municipality furnished with staff and equipment

baseline.comment: None

target.comment: LPMOs at each demonstration location established, staffed, equipped and trained

actual.comment: Three LPMOs were established and three subcontracts were signed. The LPMOs consist of fixed-term staffs and are located in three local EPBs, Tianjin, Jiangsu and Hubei.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Project Implementation Manual (PIM) developed

baseline.comment: PIM for other GEF project can be used as reference

target.comment: PIM finalised and used as guidance for project implementation

actual.comment: One PIM was finalised before inception workshop

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Staff of PT and LPMOs staff trained about the PIM and relevant requirements of GEF and UNDP on project management

baseline.comment: None

target.comment: Staff trained and project management capacity strengthened

actual.comment: Two workshops were organised to train LPMO staff: one in July 2014, and the other in Jan 2015.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Routine project management activities undertaken to ensure the smooth and timely implementation of the project. The activities include but not limited to: drafting TORs, select and contract with consultants, organize M&E activities, organize the review of substantial report

baseline.comment: None

target.comment: Efficient and effective project management leading to achievement of project objectives

actual.comment: Ongoing. The steering groups were established both at national and provincial levels. In addition, the coordination mechanism and management regulations in the local level for the project implementation have been established.
